org.jamesframework.core.subset

Class SubsetSolution

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jamesframework.core.problems.sol.Solution
      • org.jamesframework.core.subset.SubsetSolution

  • public class SubsetSolution
extends Solution
    High-level subset solution modeled in terms of IDs of selected items. The subset is sampled from a data set of items which are each required to be identified with a unique integer ID. By default, the IDs are unordered. If desired, they can be ordered according to the natural ordering of integers (ascending) or a custom comparator, by using an appropriate constructor. In the latter case, it is safe to cast the views returned by getSelectedIDs(), getUnselectedIDs() and getAllIDs() to the NavigableSet subtype.
    Author:
    Herman De Beukelaer

    • Constructor Detail

      • SubsetSolution

        public SubsetSolution(Set<Integer> allIDs)
        Creates a new subset solution given the set of all IDs, each corresponding to an underlying entity, from which a subset is to be selected. Initially, no IDs are selected. Note: IDs are copied to the internal data structures of the subset solution; no reference is stored to the set given at construction. IDs are stored in unordered sets.
        Parameters:
        allIDs - set of all IDs from which a subset is to be selected
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if allIDs is null or contains any null elements
        IllegalArgumentException - if allIDs is empty

      • SubsetSolution

        public SubsetSolution(Set<Integer> allIDs,
                      Set<Integer> selectedIDs)
        Creates a new subset solution given the set of all IDs, and the set of currently selected IDs. Note: IDs are copied to the internal data structures of the subset solution; no reference is stored to the sets given at construction. IDs are stored in unordered sets.
        Parameters:
        allIDs - set of all IDs from which a subset is to be selected
        selectedIDs - set of currently selected IDs (subset of all IDs)
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if allIDs or selectedIDs are null or contain any null elements
        IllegalArgumentException - if allIDs is empty or selectedIDs is not a subset of allIDs

      • SubsetSolution

        public SubsetSolution(Set<Integer> allIDs,
                      boolean naturalOrder)
        Creates a new subset solution given the set of all IDs, each corresponding to an underlying entity, from which a subset is to be selected. Initially, no IDs are selected. Note: IDs are copied to the internal data structures of the subset solution; no reference is stored to the set given at construction. If naturalOrder is true, the sets of selected, unselected and all IDs are represented as navigable sorted sets ordered according to the natural ordering of integers (ascending); else, no ordering is imposed.
        Parameters:
        allIDs - set of all IDs from which a subset is to be selected
        naturalOrder - if naturalOrder is true, IDs will be ordered according to their natural ordering; else, no ordering is imposed on the IDs
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if allIDs is null or contains any null elements
        IllegalArgumentException - if allIDs is empty

      • SubsetSolution

        public SubsetSolution(Set<Integer> allIDs,
                      Set<Integer> selectedIDs,
                      boolean naturalOrder)
        Creates a new subset solution given the set of all IDs, and the set of currently selected IDs. Note: IDs are copied to the internal data structures of the subset solution; no reference is stored to the sets given at construction. If naturalOrder is true, the sets of selected, unselected and all IDs are represented as navigable sorted sets ordered according to the natural ordering of integers (ascending); else, no ordering is imposed.
        Parameters:
        allIDs - set of all IDs from which a subset is to be selected
        selectedIDs - set of currently selected IDs (subset of all IDs)
        naturalOrder - if naturalOrder is true, IDs will be ordered according to their natural ordering; else, no ordering is imposed on the IDs
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if allIDs or selectedIDs are null or contain any null elements
        IllegalArgumentException - if allIDs is empty or selectedIDs is not a subset of allIDs

      • SubsetSolution

        public SubsetSolution(Set<Integer> allIDs,
                      Comparator<Integer> orderOfIDs)
        Creates a new subset solution given the set of all IDs, each corresponding to an underlying entity, from which a subset is to be selected. Initially, no IDs are selected. Note: IDs are copied to the internal data structures of the subset solution; no reference is stored to the set given at construction. If orderOfIDs is not null, the sets of selected, unselected and all IDs are represented as navigable sorted sets ordered according to this comparator; else, no ordering is imposed.
        Parameters:
        allIDs - set of all IDs from which a subset is to be selected
        orderOfIDs - comparator according to which IDs are ordered, allowed to be null in which case no order is imposed
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if allIDs is null or contains any null elements
        IllegalArgumentException - if allIDs is empty

      • SubsetSolution

        public SubsetSolution(Set<Integer> allIDs,
                      Set<Integer> selectedIDs,
                      Comparator<Integer> orderOfIDs)
        Creates a new subset solution given the set of all IDs, and the set of currently selected IDs. Note: IDs are copied to the internal data structures of the subset solution; no reference is stored to the sets given at construction. If orderOfIDs is not null, the sets of selected, unselected and all IDs are represented as navigable sorted sets ordered according to this comparator; else, no ordering is imposed.
        Parameters:
        allIDs - set of all IDs from which a subset is to be selected
        selectedIDs - set of currently selected IDs (subset of all IDs)
        orderOfIDs - comparator according to which IDs are ordered, allowed to be null in which case no order is imposed
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if allIDs or selectedIDs are null or contain any null elements
        IllegalArgumentException - if allIDs is empty or selectedIDs is not a subset of allIDs

      • SubsetSolution

        public SubsetSolution(SubsetSolution sol)
        Copy constructor. Creates a new subset solution which is identical to the given solution, but does not have any reference to any data structures contained within the given solution (deep copy). The obtained subset solution will have exactly the same selected/unselected IDs as the given solution, and will impose the same ordering on the IDs (if any).
        Parameters:
        sol - solution to copy (deep copy)

    • Method Detail

      • copy

        public SubsetSolution copy()
        Create a deep copy of this subset solution, obtained through the copy constructor.
        Specified by:
        copy in class Solution
        Returns:
        deep copy of this subset solution

      • getOrderOfIDs

        public Comparator<Integer> getOrderOfIDs()
        Get the comparator according to which the IDs are ordered, as specified at construction. May return null which means that no order has been imposed.
        Returns:
        comparator according to which IDs are ordered, may be null

      • select

        public boolean select(int ID)
        Select the given ID. If there is no entity with the given ID, a SolutionModificationException is thrown. If the ID is currently already selected, the subset solution is not modified and false is returned. Finally, true is returned if the ID has been successfully selected.
        Parameters:
        ID - ID to be selected
        Returns:
        true if the ID has been successfully selected, false if it was already selected
        Throws:
        SolutionModificationException - if there is no entity with this ID

      • deselect

        public boolean deselect(int ID)
        Deselect the given ID. If there is no entity with the given ID, a SolutionModificationException is thrown. If the ID is currently not selected, the subset solution is not modified and false is returned. Finally, true is returned if the ID has been successfully deselected.
        Parameters:
        ID - ID to be deselected
        Returns:
        true if the ID has been successfully deselected, false if it is currently not selected
        Throws:
        SolutionModificationException - if there is no entity with this ID

      • selectAll

        public boolean selectAll(Collection<Integer> IDs)
        Select all IDs contained in the given collection. Returns true if the subset solution was modified by this operation, i.e. if at least one previously unselected ID has been selected.
        Parameters:
        IDs - collection of IDs to be selected
        Returns:
        true if the subset solution was modified
        Throws:
        SolutionModificationException - if the given collection contains at least one ID which does not correspond to an entity
        NullPointerException - if null is passed or the given collection contains at least one null element

      • deselectAll

        public boolean deselectAll(Collection<Integer> IDs)
        Deselect all IDs contained in the given collection. Returns true if the subset solution was modified by this operation, i.e. if at least one previously selected ID has been deselected.
        Parameters:
        IDs - collection of IDs to be deselected
        Returns:
        true if the subset solution was modified
        Throws:
        SolutionModificationException - if the given collection contains at least one ID which does not correspond to an entity
        NullPointerException - if null is passed or the given collection contains at least one null element

      • selectAll

        public void selectAll()
        Select all IDs.

      • deselectAll

        public void deselectAll()
        Deselect all IDs.

      • getSelectedIDs

        public Set<Integer> getSelectedIDs()
        Returns an unmodifiable view of the set of currently selected IDs. Any attempt to modify the returned set will result in an UnsupportedOperationException. If the IDs are ordered (see getOrderOfIDs()), it is safe to cast the returned view to the NavigableSet subtype.
        Returns:
        unmodifiable view of currently selected IDs

      • getUnselectedIDs

        public Set<Integer> getUnselectedIDs()
        Returns an unmodifiable view of the set of currently non selected IDs. Any attempt to modify the returned set will result in an UnsupportedOperationException. If the IDs are ordered (see getOrderOfIDs()), it is safe to cast the returned view to the NavigableSet subtype.
        Returns:
        unmodifiable view of currently non selected IDs

      • getAllIDs

        public Set<Integer> getAllIDs()
        Returns an unmodifiable view of the set of all IDs. Any attempt to modify the returned set will result in an UnsupportedOperationException. If the IDs are ordered (see getOrderOfIDs()), it is safe to cast the returned view to the NavigableSet subtype. This set will always be equal to the union of getSelectedIDs() and getUnselectedIDs().
        Returns:
        unmodifiable view of all IDs

      • getNumSelectedIDs

        public int getNumSelectedIDs()
        Get the number of IDs which are currently selected. Corresponds to the size of the selected subset.
        Returns:
        number of selected IDs

      • getNumUnselectedIDs

        public int getNumUnselectedIDs()
        Get the number of IDs which are currently unselected.
        Returns:
        number of unselected IDs

      • getTotalNumIDs

        public int getTotalNumIDs()
        Get the total number of IDs. The returned number will always be equal to the sum of getNumSelectedIDs() and getNumUnselectedIDs().
        Returns:
        total number of IDs

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Object other)
        Checks whether the given other object represents the same subset solution. Subset solutions are considered equal if and only if they contain exactly the same selected and unselected IDs.
        Specified by:
        equals in class Solution
        Parameters:
        other - other object to check for equality
        Returns:
        true if the other object is also a subset solution and contains exactly the same selected and unselected IDs as this solution

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Computes a hash code that is consistent with the implementation of equals(Object) meaning that the same hash code is returned for equal subset solutions. The computed hash code is a linear combination of the hash codes of both the set of selected and unselected IDs, added to a constant.
        Specified by:
        hashCode in class Solution
        Returns:
        hash code of this subset solution

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Creates a formatted string containing the selected IDs.
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        formatted string
